title: 113_hr1730
content: The Act titled "Cell Phone Theft Prevention Act of 2013" introduces measures for mobile device theft prevention by amending the Communications Act of 1934. The Cell Phone Theft Prevention Act of 2013 prohibits providers of mobile services from offering service on a stolen device reported by the account holder or another service provider. Providers must inform each other when a device is reported stolen. The Cell Phone Theft Prevention Act of 2013 requires providers to block service on stolen devices and allows for remote deletion of data on mobile devices. Mobile devices must have a unique identification number and be configured for mobile service. The Cell Phone Theft Prevention Act of 2013 mandates the ability to remotely delete data on stolen mobile devices and prohibits the alteration or removal of mobile device identification numbers. Violators may face fines or imprisonment. The Cell Phone Theft Prevention Act of 2013 requires the ability to remotely delete data on stolen mobile devices and prohibits altering or removing mobile device identification numbers. Violators may face fines, imprisonment, or both. Definitions for terms like commercial mobile data service, commercial mobile service, mobile device, and mobile device identification number are provided in the Act. The Cell Phone Theft Prevention Act of 2013 mandates providers of commercial mobile service to report to the FCC on their efforts to comply with requirements regarding mobile device identification numbers within a year of the Act's enactment. The Act will take effect on a specified date. The Cell Phone Theft Prevention Act of 2013 requires providers of commercial mobile service to comply with device identification number requirements within 2 years of the Act's enactment. Compliance is necessary for devices manufactured or imported before the specified date, to the extent technologically feasible. Definitions in the Act apply to this section.
